---
title: "Nick Strayer's CV"
author: Nick Strayer
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
# These variables determine how the the data is loaded and how the exports are
# done.
params:
  # Is the goal of this knit to build a document that is exported to PDF? 
  # If true: links are turned into footnotes at the end of the document
  pdf: true
  
  # Just the copied URL from the sheet. If using local csv's instead simply put null or 'csvs'
  positions_sheet_loc: "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14MQICF2F8-vf8CKPF1m4lyGKO6_thG-4aSwat1e2TWc"
 
  # Where will the PDF of this cv be hosted?
  CV_PDF_LOC: "https://github.com/nstrayer/cv/raw/master/strayer_cv.pdf"
  
  # Where will the HTML be hosted?
  CV_HTML_LOC: "nickstrayer.me/cv/"
  
  # Where is this file hosted?
  SOURCE_LOC: "https://github.com/nstrayer/cv"
output:
  pagedown::html_resume:
    css: ['css/cv.css']
    # set it to true for a self-contained HTML page but it'll take longer to render
    self_contained: false
---


```{r, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  results='asis', 
  echo = FALSE
)

library(glue)
library(tidyverse)
library(magrittr)
library(cvdown)

# Going old school and want to use csvs instead of google sheets for data? 
if(params$positions_sheet_loc == "csv"){
  data <- gather_data_from_csvs(positions_loc    = "csvs/positions.csv",
                                skills_loc       = "csvs/language_skills.csv",
                                text_blocks_loc  = "csvs/text_blocks.csv",
                                contact_info_loc = "csvs/contact_info.csv")
} else {
  # Load data for CV from google sheets
  data <- gather_data_from_googlesheets(params$positions_sheet_loc, public_sheet = TRUE)
}


pretty_link <- function(link) stringr::str_remove(link, "https://|http://")


# Get function to load data for CV/Resume
printer <- new_cv_printer(data, params$pdf)
```



```{r}
# When in export mode the little dots are unaligned, so fix that. 
if(params$pdf){
  cat("
  <style>
  :root{
    --decorator-outer-offset-left: -6.5px;
  }
  </style>")
}
```
